calculator

Class StandardCalc

  • java.lang.Object
    • calculator.StandardCalc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Calculator

    public class StandardCalc
extends java.lang.Object
implements Calculator
    A class for infix expression.

    This class uses method evaluate(String) to calculate the value of an
    expression in infix notation, throws InvalidExpressionException
    when the expression is empty or there are unknown operators or unbalanced
    parentheses in it. The main idea is to use Shunting-yard algorithm to
    convert infix expression into postfix expression (Reverse Polish Notation)
    then call RevPolishCalc.evaluate(String) to calculate it.

    Author:
    Bruce
    See Also:
    Shunting-yard algorithm from Wikipedia

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public float evaluate(java.lang.String what)
               throws InvalidExpressionException
        A method that calculate the value of an expression.

        This overriding method is to implement the evaluation of expression
        in infix notation. This method is using the Shunting-yard algorithm to
        convert an infix expression into postfix expression, which is also called
        reverse polish notation. Then calculate the postfix expression.

        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface Calculator
        Parameters:
        what - the string contains an expression.
        Returns:
        the value after calculate the expression.
        Throws:
        InvalidExpressionException - when the expression is empty or
        unbalanced, or there are unknown operators in it.
        See Also:
        Calculator.evaluate(java.lang.String)
